stimulusHtml: Which of the following best supports the researcherâ€™s claim?

features.html: A researcher measured the temperature at which two different samples of double-stranded DNA denature (separate into single strands). Sample 1 denatured at a significantly lower temperature than sample 2 did. Based on the data, the researcher claims that the DNA in sample 2 is composed of a higher percentage of guanine and cytosine than the DNA in sample 1 is.

choicesHtml: The bonds between guanine and cytosine are covalent bonds, which require more energy to disrupt than those between adenine and thymine.
Guanine-cytosine pairs denature at a higher temperature because they have more hydrogen bonds between them than adenine-thymine pairs do.
Adenine-thymine pairs require less energy to separate because adenine and thymine are both single-ring bases.
Guanine-cytosine pairs require more energy to separate because one is a purine and one is a pyrimidine.
